content.raw:
It's more than the `CXX_STANDARD`. There is work involved with supporting more platforms, and time is in short supply. Additionally, we currently have no one asking for xenial support, and I don’t expect that to change. Also, I don’t plan on releasing ign-cmake2 to xenial, see [here](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake2-release/src/default/).

The only code that we are developing that targets xenial is gazebo10 and its dependencies \(sdformat6 for example\), and anything clients require. Beyond that, I want to keep everything as simple, straightforward, and free of exceptions as possible.

I get that we might be losing a potential audience, but that’s a trade off I’m willing to make.

Given that, I’ll  modify this PR to bump the version of ign-plugin to 1.0, and create an ign-plugin0 branch which would leave open the possibility of creating a ign-plugins0.X version that uses ign-cmake1. I’ll wait for the other outstanding PR to be merged first.
content.html:
It's more than the CXX_STANDARD. There is work involved with supporting more platforms, and time is in short supply. Additionally, we currently have no one asking for xenial support, and I don’t expect that to change. Also, I don’t plan on releasing ign-cmake2 to xenial, see here.

The only code that we are developing that targets xenial is gazebo10 and its dependencies (sdformat6 for example), and anything clients require. Beyond that, I want to keep everything as simple, straightforward, and free of exceptions as possible.

I get that we might be losing a potential audience, but that’s a trade off I’m willing to make.

Given that, I’ll modify this PR to bump the version of ign-plugin to 1.0, and create an ign-plugin0 branch which would leave open the possibility of creating a ign-plugins0.X version that uses ign-cmake1. I’ll wait for the other outstanding PR to be merged first.

content.raw:
Consistency doesn’t really gain us anything in this case, and loses us support of an entire platform.

I thought one of the motivations for the ignition projects is to make our work more reusable and less of a single-purpose monolith.

It’s merely one line of build system script: `CXX_STANDARD 17)` which makes the difference between this repo supporting or not supporting an entire LTS platform.
content.html:
Consistency doesn’t really gain us anything in this case, and loses us support of an entire platform.

I thought one of the motivations for the ignition projects is to make our work more reusable and less of a single-purpose monolith.

It’s merely one line of build system script: CXX_STANDARD 17) which makes the difference between this repo supporting or not supporting an entire LTS platform.

content.raw:
I commented on this [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/15/ign-cmake2/diff#comment-75687240) before noticing your comment.

I am very much in favor of keeping Xenial support \(or at the very least retaining the ability to build from source on Xenial\).

As you mentioned, this repo works just fine off of `ign-cmake1` or `ign-cmake2`. Right now it’s set up to prefer 1 over 2, but it would be totally fine to flip that where it prefers 2 and then tries to fall back on 1 if 2 cannot be found.

Since we’re not using any C\+\+17 features and don’t have any plan to \(since we’re freezing that code after Pull Request #12 and don’t have foreseeable plans to add any more features\), we don’t stand to gain anything by setting C\+\+17 as a dependency.
content.html:
I commented on this here before noticing your comment.

I am very much in favor of keeping Xenial support (or at the very least retaining the ability to build from source on Xenial).

As you mentioned, this repo works just fine off of ign-cmake1 or ign-cmake2. Right now it’s set up to prefer 1 over 2, but it would be totally fine to flip that where it prefers 2 and then tries to fall back on 1 if 2 cannot be found.

Since we’re not using any C++17 features and don’t have any plan to (since we’re freezing that code after Pull Request #12 and don’t have foreseeable plans to add any more features), we don’t stand to gain anything by setting C++17 as a dependency.

content.raw:
I would hold up on this…

I'm totally fine with preferring `ign-cmake2` over `ign-cmake1`, and updating gtest should be fine.

But I would _strongly_ discourage migrating this repo to depend on C\+\+17 when we’re only using C\+\+11 features. The only thing that would do is limit its usability without offering any benefit.

Ideally, a build system should always express its minimal dependency so that the maximum number of users can take advantage of it. I understand that with the other ignition projects we fully intend to leverage C\+\+17 features, and I fully support that. But since we’re not using any of those features here \(and we don’t have any foreseeable plan to\), I don’t think it makes sense to lock this project’s build system into C\+\+17.
content.html:
I would hold up on this…

I'm totally fine with preferring ign-cmake2 over ign-cmake1, and updating gtest should be fine.

But I would strongly discourage migrating this repo to depend on C++17 when we’re only using C++11 features. The only thing that would do is limit its usability without offering any benefit.

Ideally, a build system should always express its minimal dependency so that the maximum number of users can take advantage of it. I understand that with the other ignition projects we fully intend to leverage C++17 features, and I fully support that. But since we’re not using any of those features here (and we don’t have any foreseeable plan to), I don’t think it makes sense to lock this project’s build system into C++17.

content.raw: yeah, we should update that formula

I know gazebo-11 is dropping xenial support, but I thought there was some interest in ign-plugin from ROS or others outside of gazebo. If so, then maybe we could make an `ign-plugin0` branch from the version of default before merging this? Then we could bump to major version 1 with ign-cmake2 / c++17.

content.raw: Right, it’s not necessary. The primary reason is that we are targeting bionic, c\+\+17, etc for gazebo-11 and dropping xenial support. This repository falls into the new-for-gazebo11 category. Consistency is nice.
content.html: Right, it’s not necessary. The primary reason is that we are targeting bionic, c++17, etc for gazebo-11 and dropping xenial support. This repository falls into the new-for-gazebo11 category. Consistency is nice.

content.raw:
## Pros

* allows c++17 features in ign-plugin

## Cons

* breaks xenial support

## Analysis

I think ign-plugin currently is fully working with gz11 without this change since it can find `ign-cmake2` if `ign-cmake1` is not found. So I don't think this is strictly necessary, but we should decide if we want to support this package on xenial, which is still an LTS, or if we would rather have c++17.

cc @mxgrey
content.html:
Pros

  • allows c++17 features in ign-plugin

Cons

  • breaks xenial support

Analysis

I think ign-plugin currently is fully working with gz11 without this change since it can find ign-cmake2 if ign-cmake1 is not found. So I don't think this is strictly necessary, but we should decide if we want to support this package on xenial, which is still an LTS, or if we would rather have c++17.

cc @mxgrey

content.html: We'll have to make some CI updates before merging this
